html: The servant’s mission to “all nations” (Isaiah 11:10-12; 41:2; 42:1, 6; 45:1, 13; 49:6, 22; 52:10, 15; 55:4) implies that his restoration of Jehovah’s people dispersed among the nations gains worldwide notoriety. Likewise, just as Moses won the attention of Israel’s tribes in Egypt when he petitioned Pharaoh for their release, so the servant gains the attention of the Jacob/Israel category of Jehovah’s people at the time he fulfills his mission. A key premise of the servant’s platform are the prophecies that foretell Jehovah’s restoration of his people, which no one among the nations has predicted or suspected.
